result.execSummary:
The defendant Chelsey Lynn Ninham-Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment (minimum of 35 hours per week).  In the event that the defendant must look for work, then a minimum of 3 job applications must be submitted per week with copies of each application being provided to Probation & Parole.
No consumption or possession of alcohol & no entering upon the premises of any bar or tavern.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Chelsey Lynn Ninham-Thomas in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:02 PM. State - resolved - plead g/nc to count #1 as alleged, $300 fine plus costs and surcharges; plead g/nc to counts #2 and #3 as alleged, #4 - DRI, withhold sentence and place on probatgion for 18 months with conditions of: court costs on each count, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns or similar class B establishments, employment/school, 120 hours of community service. Lynch and Ninham-Thomas agree. Court dismisses and reads in count #4. Ninham-Thomas pleas NC to counts #1, #2 and #3 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Lynch makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Ninham-Thomas makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #2 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: court costs on each count - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 120 hours of community service; count #1 - $300 fine plus costs and surcharges - paid thru probation on counts #2 and #3, submit DNA sample with expunction information, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant Chelsey Lynn Ninham-Thomas in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:34 AM. Lynch has went over complaint with defendant, waives further reading, enters NG pleas to all counts. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Chelsey Lynn Ninham-Thomas in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Chelsey Lynn Ninham-Thomas in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:32 PM. Also called a non-filed case of 15-19726. Burns - resolved - provides court with questionnaire. Court asks if offer is still valid due to new charges pending. State responds - offer will still be valid - has complied with victim notification requirements with no response - joint recommendation of a g/nc plea to counts #2 and #3 as alleged, #1 - DRI, withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months on each count, court costs on each court, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, 125 hours of community service, employment/school. Burns and Ninham-Thomas agree. Court dismisses and reads in count #1. Ninham-Thomas pleads NC to counts #2 and #3 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Ninham-Thomas makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #2 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: court costs on each court - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, 125 hours of community service, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, credit for 5 days only if revoked, eligible for expunction under 973.015, right to appeal, adjourned. On 15-19726 - Court reviews probable cause statement. Burns asks for a signature bond in this matter for stated reasons. State - bond - objects to signature bond for stated reasons but will stipulate to it resistently. Court - bond - will reduce bond to $2000 signature bond and set for INIT on 12/16/15 at 10:00 AM, no consumption of alcohol.
